newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Asia Product Swaps - Gas oil drifts in quiet trade.
newsitem.headline: Asia Product Swaps - Gas oil drifts in quiet trade.

text.p: Singapore gas oil swaps drifted sideways in quiet trading at midday on Tuesday as the market awaited fresh physical indicators, traders said.
"The market is steady, there is not much going on right now," one broker said.
May swaps were last quoted at $25.50/$25.70, down a mere five cents from Monday, brokers said.
The May/June backwardation was unchanged at a $1.00/$1.10 per barrel.
Traders said the market has lost a lot of its volatility as a result of the recent large purchases by local traders.
"The prices are coming down slowly and you can see this from the physical bids and offers," one trader said.
The local traders have since early March bought more than 15 million barrels but the purchases did not lead to a sharp price hike.
Physical prices have instead trekked a steady downward path from a high of about $28.75 per barrel to around $26.00 over the past two months.
Slipping prices and the steep backwardation are expected to deter traders from planning another round of large arbitrage exports from the West, industry sources said.
Fuel oil swaps were steady with May quoted at $98.00/$99.00, brokers said.
